definition: to study the underlying principles, esp. in neo-Confucian rational learning 理學|理学[li3 xue2]/word for Western natural sciences during late Qing
square/frame/rule/(legal) case/style/character/standard/pattern/(grammar) case/(classical) to obstruct/to hinder/(classical) to arrive/to come/(classical) to investigate/to study exhaustively
thing/object/matter/abbr. for physics 物理
to study the underlying principle to acquire knowledge (idiom); pursuing knowledge to the end

sentences.english: He expounded his epistemology and methodology through exploring things to acquire knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 他以“格物致知”闡述其認識論和方法論。

sentences.english: Conscious Awareness of Innate Knowledge instead the Investigation of Things, he made a whole new interpretation of the phenomena of nature.
sentences.chinese: 他以致知代替誠意，對格物進行了全新的解釋。

sentences.english: True for the contemporary of the phenomena of nature, everyone is learning.
sentences.chinese: 真爲當代之格物，人人當學。

sentences.english: Technology for the body, know as the source, inquiring.
sentences.chinese: 技爲體，識爲源，格物致知。

definition: to study the underlying principle to acquire knowledge (idiom); pursuing knowledge to the end

the Confucian Six Arts, namely: rites or etiquette 禮|礼[li3] (禮儀|礼仪[li3 yi2]), music 樂|乐[yue3] (音樂|音乐[yin1 yue4]), archery 射[she4] (射箭[she4 jian4]), charioteering 御[yu4] (駕車|驾车[jia4 che1]), calligraphy or literacy 書|书[shu1] (識字|识字[shi2 zi4]), mathematics or reckoning 數|数[shu4] (計算|计算[ji4 suan4])/another name for the Six Classics 六經|六经[Liu4 jing1]
School of Mind/Neo-Confucian Idealistic School (from Song to mid-Qing times, c. 1000-1750, typified by the teachings of Wang Yangming 王陽明|王阳明[Wang2 Yang2 ming2])
Master Zhu, another name for Zhu Xi 朱熹
doctrine (esp. religious)/argumentation (in a speech or essay)
instinctive understanding, esp. of ethical issues (idiom); untrained, but with an inborn sense of right and wrong/innate moral sense
vigorously pursuing knowledge, while scrupulously abiding by the rules of decorum (idiom)
Confucian
Confucian school, founded by Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3] (551-479 BC) and Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3] (c. 372-c. 289 BC)
Confucianism
to practice diligently/to act energetically
restrain yourself and return to the rites (idiom, from Analects); to subdue self and observe proprieties/(any number of possible translations)
Western learning (intellectual movement in the late Qing)/also called 洋務運動|洋务运动
The Analects of Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3]
a sage/wise and holy man/virtuous ruler/Buddhist lama/wine
to interpret and make glossaries and commentaries on classic texts
